intro: Psychotria goniocarpa, commonly known as the "Coca plant" or "Cocaine plant," is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, white to greenish-white flowers. Its fruit is a globose, fleshy capsule that contains numerous seeds. The plant is notable for containing alkaloids, including cocaine, which has significant pharmacological and illicit uses.
